{"step_by_step_thinking": "The radiographs of the patient revealed radiolucent areas around several of her mandibular teeth, all of which tested vital on the electric pulp tester. This indicates that the teeth have vital pulps and are not associated with any periapical pathology such as granulomas, periapical osteofibroses, or chronic periapical abscesses. Therefore, the most likely explanation for the radiolucent areas is bone hypoplasias associated with opalescent teeth.", "answer_choice": "D"}
